result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles C Leofilos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles C Leofilos is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Charles C Leofilos was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Charles C Leofilos was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: No sentence credit if probation is revoked as the credit was applied to the OWI count.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended. 
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-AODA assessment and any follow-up.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond of $250.00 applied.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

To commence immediately.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.  Court grants the defendant 42 days of sentence credit.  On April 21, 2017 the Court amends the JOC to 46 days of sentence credit.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt:
11:34 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea count 1 & 2 with no repeater.  State concurs.  Atty Selsing concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 2, striking the repeater and orders count 3 be dismissed outright.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Selsing.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 1

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended. 
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-AODA assessment and any follow-up.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

COUNT 2

-90 days county jail.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.
-$600 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DL revocation - 24 months
-IID - 24 months.
-AODA(Marquette)
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

-Court grants the defendant 42 days of sentence credit.
-Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Court adjourned at 11:45 a.m.

Court sets for Status Hearing on April 4, 2017 at 11:00 a.m.  All motions and witness lists are to be filed by April 3, 2017.
